page.title: 16COUNTY HALL_EXTERIOR
page.content: County Hall was built in two phases from 1979 to 1982 at the cost of Â£9.5 million. Five architects worked on the design and two hundred men helped to build it. County Hall is in Morpeth because there is{good road; rail and {air access}and the County owned the land. The{Queen Mother }laid the foundation stone. 80 trees,with red and yellow leaves have been planted in her honour in Queen Elizabeth Avenue. There is also a statue of {Eric the {Red,}Eric Bloodaxe.He was a Viking and he had his head chopped off. On the windows are works by John Rothwell which show Northumbrians like Grace darling,and our customs and ways of life,_{pigeon keeping,leek growing. {Northumbria pipes, Paste eggs etc.
